text: Union County is a county in the U.S. state of New Mexico. As of the 2020 census, the population was 4,079, making it the fourth-least populous county in New Mexico. Its county seat is Clayton. The county was formed in 1894. ==References== Category:New Mexico counties Category:1890s establishments in New Mexico Territory Category:1894 establishments in the United States
title: Union County, New Mexico
